descript.abstract: New York City Truck Routes is a line theme representing designated truck routes in New York City. Attribute information indicates the types of truck traffic permitted on various route segments, street name and segment length. The New York City designated truck routes map data are derived from maps and digital files produced by the NYC Department of Transportation. They are developed from, but do not perfectly align with the NYC DCP LION file. Data was realigned to the NYCMap basemap.
descript.purpose: Indicates designated truck routes. Most divided roads are represented with a single line.
descript.supplinf: Please see the NYC Department of Transportation website at http://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/motorist/trucks.shtml for more information.

idinfo.accconst: May only be used by current Columbia University affiliates.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

procstep.procdesc: The New York City designated truck routes map data are derived from maps and digital files produced by the NYC Department of Transportation. They are developed from, but do not perfectly align with the NYC DCP LION file.
Data was realigned to the NYCMap basemap.

PDF maps were downloaded from the NYC Department of Transportation at http://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/trans_maps/truckroutes.html. ComCarto updated the existing GIS files using on-screen digitizing, to the NYCMap street centerlines. Where street names differed between sources, the NYCMap name was used.

PDF maps were downloaded from the NYC Department of Transportation at http://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/trans_maps/truckroutes.html (Summer 2007 edition). ComCarto updated the existing GIS files using on-screen digitizing, to the NYCMap street centerlines.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: local or all truck traffic allowed

overview.eaover:
The Local Truck Route Network is designated for trucks with an origin and destination for the purpose of delivery, loading or servicing within a borough. Trucks should only use non-designated routes for the purpose of accessing their destination.
The Through Truck Route Network is primarily composed of major urban arterials and highways and must be used by trucks that have neither an origin or destination within the borough.
Manhattan and Staten Island contain Limited Truck Zones (as depicted on the Truck Route Map) with special time and size restrictions.
All commercial vehicles and trucks are prohibited from utilizing the Parkway system in New York City.
